qas.question: have the Burmese people ever shown any reservations about the ruling government bodies?

answers.text: Burmese resentment was strong and was vented in violent riots that paralysed Yangon (Rangoon) on occasion all the way until the 1930s.

qas.question: What were some of problems experienced with the colonialism of Burma by the British?

answers.text: Some of the discontent was caused by a disrespect for Burmese culture and traditions

qas.question: How long was U Wisara on a strike were he refused subsistence ?
Was U Wisara able to survive  the protest?

answers.text: died in prison after a 166-day hunger strike

qas.question: Why was U Wisara involved in a resistance movement of such extremes ?

answers.text: to protest against a rule that forbade him from wearing his Buddhist robes while imprisoned.

context: <a0_0>Burmese resentment was strong and was vented in violent riots that paralysed Yangon (Rangoon) on occasion all the way until the 1930s.<a0_0/> <a1_0>Some of the discontent was caused by a disrespect for Burmese culture and traditions<a1_0/> such as the British refusal to remove shoes when they entered pagodas. Buddhist monks became the vanguards of the independence movement. U Wisara, an activist monk, <a3_0>died in prison after a <a2_0>166-day hunger strike<a3_0/><a2_0/> <a4_0>to protest against a rule that forbade him from wearing his Buddhist robes while imprisoned.
